title: Web Developer
description:
Full Time. One year contract. East London

Code Club is looking for a highly motivated and passionate web developer to help us build the tools and web services that will children across the UK, and worldwide, to learn how great it is to be able to write code.

About Code Club Code Club is a network of free, volunteer-led, after-school coding clubs for children aged 9 to 11. In the clubs, children have fun making computer games, websites and applications. We have over 2000 clubs in the UK and 300 more worldwide. We also train teachers to deliver the new Computing curriculum through our programme Code Club Pro.

REQUIREMENTS

About you

  • You’re passionate about web development, keep up with the latest developments and technologies
  • Building modern, fast, responsive websites using HTML, CSS, JavaScript is second nature to you.
  • You are proficient in either Ruby or Python, and enjoy learning new programming languages.
  • You believe in building high quality software and that practices such as unit testing, TDD, BDD and Continuous Integration are key to making this possible.
  • You know how to make Git and Github.com bend to your will, and hardly ever cry when you have to merge a pull request.
  • You have an online profile, such as a web portfolio, a github.com account, or a stackoverflow.com profile that shows us awesome you are (we’d like to see it when you apply).
  • You’re able to contribute well when working in teams or when working on tasks alone. You might also have some experience of working with remote team mates.

Make sure you include anything else you think might be relevant such as existing projects, previous work and links to your online profiles (github.com, stackoverflow.com etc).

Our interview process will consist of a phone screen, a technical interview and finally a face to face interview where you’ll meet some of the team.

We will consider remote workers for this role, with a preference towards those who can travel to London easily, and that can work in the same time zone as us.

We’re hoping you’ll have a few of these skills to:

  • Experience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL or MySQL
  • Experience with non-relational databases such as Redis, MongoDB etc
  • Web frameworks such as Django, Flask or Ruby on Rails
  • Javascript frameworks such as AngularJS, Ember.js or Backbone.js.
  • In-depth knowledge of the HTTP protocol (you know your PUT from your POST)
  • Some experience in RESTful API design

BENEFITS

What’s in it for you:

  • Salary circa £35k depending on experience
  • An opportunity to be an important part of a fast growing organisation making a huge impact
  • Working with a small but expanding team of passionate talented people who want to change the world
  • A chance to expand your network and contacts - Code Club is a high profile name, we work with government funders and corporate partners including Google and Samsung
  • A nice office in Bethnal Green, East London (no really, it’s nice!) including a cafe with great food
  • Possibility of flexible working hours and potentially some working from home
  • Use of the space hopper

Applications must be received by 9am Monday 2nd February

No recruitment agencies please.

title: VP of Software Engineering for Cloud Security Company
description:
Company Description

Bat Blue Networks is an innovative Cloud Security-as-a-Service that leverages a unique Globally distributed Security Abstraction Layer (Global SeAL) technology to deliver uniform and consistent security for all organizational Brick & Mortar facilities, Cloud & SaaS applications, as well as Mobile and IoT assets. Bat Blue is an expansion-stage start-up with stable products and enterprise clients.

Our key differentiator is the capability to functions as a comprehensive security infrastructure displacement solution supporting all ports, protocols, and applications, compared to today's proxy point products in-the-cloud. Bat Blue's technology runs on a proprietary and patent-pending platform that enhances end-to-end performance between 30- 400% over traditional product-based security and tier 1 ISP combinations.

The offering is well established having gone into production in 2012 and most recently was responsible for the delivery of the 2014 FIFA Brazil World Cup Games.

Job Description

Bat Blue is searching for a Vice President of Software Engineering to offload this essential function from the founder who is functioning in multiple roles including CEO and CTO. This is the founder's third successful start-up and he is experienced in successfully transitioning roles to other leaders within the organization.

This is a key management role and this individual will be a stakeholder in setting the direction of, and building success with the organization's technology offering. Strong leadership is imperative, as this is a key leadership role within the organization. Integrity, strength of character, ability to thrive under pressure, humility, reliability and surefooted confidence are all integral attributes of the management team and essential for this role.

We are extremely passionate about what we do, technology fearless, with a history of creative innovation and execution. We expect the same for this role, which is best suited for a creative, fearless, and passionate, yet humble person who knows how to execute and has staying power.

Bat Blue has grown 300+% year-over-year and the leader we seek must have the acumen to initially thrive with a small team, and the experience to grow and manage a successful global development operation.

Compensation: Six-figure base with a healthy equity position

Experience:

  • This is a Player/Coach role which requires fresh and current hands-on development experience
  • This role is not for an individual whose primary experience is in the Windows Environment
  • 15+ years of software development experience
  • 10+ years of leadership experience
  • Deployed 3 Large Scale or 1 Globally Distributed Application

Location: Greater New York Area

Qualifications

  • Planning – Experienced in translating brainstorming sessions into specific qualified and quantified functions. Ability to develop detailed plans with specific goals, priorities, timelines and budgets to effectuate ideas into products and product feature sets.

  • Architecture – Architect that can lead the specification and development effort of the comprehensive software, infrastructure, and application architectures with consideration to timelines, scalability, globalization, security, and privacy.

  • People Manager - Extremely strong manager of people, in-house and external development resources to ensure projects meet or exceed deliverable timelines, functional objectives, and security standards. You need to know how to build a positive work environment while moving the team beyond their comfort zone to do quality work on deadline.

  • Process Manager – Diligent manager of the development lifecycle with agile / waterfall methodologies with the ability to mentor team members in these methodologies.

  • Team Building – Well connected to the community at-large to recruit and attract top-notch talent to grow the team. The proper candidate will know, will have work experience with and be respected by a slew of people from various development disciplines.

  • Discipline – Experience in network and application security is an absolute MUST! Application integrity testing and ethical hacking a very valuable plus. Security, integrity, and availability of systems is critical.

  • Development – Strong and active developer with experience in: - Structured, general purpose programming languages such as C and Java

          - Scripting languages such as Python or Ruby

      - REST APIs and API development

      - Web front-ends and web User Experience

      - Mobile application development for IOS, Android, Windows

      - Large scale SQL and NoSQL Database architecture such as H-Base, Elastic Search,     MySQL, and Hadoop Eco-system

      - Mastery of the Linux / UNIX operating platform and eco-system

      - Engaged participant and active awareness of open source projects, their leads and their communities.

      - Ability to deliver high-performing “tuned” applications with a mix of software requirements, platform capabilities, and hardware specs.

      - Experienced in the QA process to drive both internal and external QA of applications for functionality and security testing.

  • Librarian / Historian – A critical must-have is extremely well documented plans and extremely well documented code. Someone who has conviction that documentation is an active part of the process and not an afterthought.

title: Software Engineer (Full Stack)
location: Washington, DC or San Francisco, CA
description:
Purpose, mastery and autonomy. We provide all three at Rally Health (rallyhealth.com), a startup that's revolutionizing health and the face of health care. Work for the purpose of improving millions of people's wellness and lifestyles. Help build our platform which includes Scala using the Play framework, MongoDB, RabbitMQ and Elasticsearch. Join an elite team of engineers and have the autonomy to architect the full solutions that scale to fit our user growth.

Here's what you'll be doing:

  • Developing highly-scalable web and mobile apps with a focus on security
  • Becoming a Scala web framework expert using Play
  • Building our internal and external REST API in Scala
  • Integrating with external APIs to customize a user’s experience

Here's what you need:

  • 3+ years of real industry experience with Java or C#
  • Expert-level design experience, including knowledge of common design patterns and relevant libraries
  • Familiarity with Scala, or a strong interest to learn
  • Familiarity with a NoSQL database such as MongoDB
  • Experience working with RESTful APIs

And for bonus points:

  • Hands-on experience using Scala with the Lift framework
  • You've built rich, interactive client-side applications using Javascript (JQuery preferred, AngularJS a plus)
  • You understand the ins and outs of document design with MongoDB

title: Cloud Software Engineer

What we offer:

Why work at DualSpark? At DualSpark we spend our days solving complex puzzles at extreme scale, which is a great workout for your brain! We work on a wide variety of projects for customers and ourselves, giving our teams the variety of experience in a broad range of industries, workloads and technologies.

Our company is built with a culture of hardcore engineering and we get hands-on to make things better. We love technology and what weâ€™re able to do with it. We value speed, experimentation, automation and continuous improvement.

We're committed to advancing your career as part of the DualSpark team. We believe in providing the budgets and time to support a process of continuous learning, and we offer the choice to work across a wide range of roles to develop mastery in multiple fields.

Whether working from our offices, remotely or onsite with our clients, we're proud of our highly supportive community who are collaborating together to get the right answers and keep our teams hustling. In our quieter moments, we find time for ourselves to focus on innovation, community & developing the DualSpark company.

title: Software Engineer
description:
You

Noom is looking for an awesome Senior Software Engineer who's a true team player and passionate about engineering, with tons of programming experience (doesn't matter if it was at Apple or in your mom’s basement) and excellent communication skills. A CS background or degree usually helps a lot, but is not a strict requirement if you really know your stuff.

Our Tech

At our core, we are a team of great engineers from world-class companies, so we take our tech very seriously. We work to improve our tools and approaches every day -- whether pushing the envelope with automated unit-tests or writing a super-optimized data analysis framework. We don't over-engineer and also don't under-engineer -- just the right tool for the job.

We take great pride in our code because we all want to innovate quickly. We build everything from Android software to C++ image recognition, from web UI to pedometer data analysis. Our apps operate off-line, and we have built lots of client-side infrastructure to lazily load and sync data with the server. This allows us to keep the server side relatively simple while still serving millions of users: Spring/Flask, Spring MVC, mySQL/Mongo.

We run Hadoop-based machine learning to find out what makes people stick to habits, create online clustering algorithms to match people to their ideal support group, serve millions of users with many terabytes of data, and tackle many difficult challenges ( http://www.quora.com/Noom-company/What-are-some-of-the-engineering-challenges-at-Noom ) every day. Because we are small dev team (17 strong), working at Noom gives you the unique opportunity to both use what we have created and build many more foundational technologies.

Our Culture

We have worked hard to build an awesome company culture ( http://www.noom.com/culture.php ), stealing a bit from Google (many of us are ex-Googlers) and improving on it to become one of Crain’s “Best Places to Work in NYC 2013” ( http://www.crainsnewyork.com/gallery/20131206/FEATURES/120909999/64 )

Our tech team works with a ton of interesting Noomers and advisers, including our in-house psychologist as well as fitness experts, physicians and researchers. We test our prototypes on sample users, averaging 2 user-tests a day, so you’ll be able to see how real people react to your work and iterate. So unlike most tech companies, you’ll interact with a diverse network of people. After all, we are team of problem solvers, always interested in learning and growing.

If you’re worried about being pigeonholed, fear not. You’ll get to choose a mission (usually for 4 - 6 months) and work on the projects you’re interested in. We also have frequent company-wide hackathons. Everyone on the team is a generalist -- we explore new frameworks, and learn them quickly. We like to learn.

We are now ready to double the size of our engineering team with some incredible engineers (read on below!).

Our Company

Noom is a New York-based health & wellness tech startup that uses mobile technology to help people lead healthier lives (22 million and counting!). While other fitness companies just track, we coach. We learn from the best research in nutrition, psychology and behavior modification and combine it with the latest tech to design next-generation health & wellness apps on Android and iOS.

We’ve built a strong foundation with hundreds of thousands of paying customers, a grant from the National Institutes of Health, $7M in Series A funding led by RRE Ventures and a team of 40 full-time Noomers -- 30 in our NYC headquarters and 10 in our foreign offices (Seoul and Berlin).

But we need your help -- read on if you think you’ve got the stuff.

Our Products

At Noom we tackle some of the world’s biggest problems -- obesity, diabetes and heart disease. We believe the best way to do this is by focusing on nutrition (TechCrunch ( http://techcrunch.com/2013/10/22/health-startup-noom-receives-nih-grant-to-study-smartphone-tech-in-eating-disorder-treatment/ )) and fitness (GigaOm ( http://gigaom.com/2013/06/11/nooms-android-fitness-app-another-example-of-why-smartphones-are-the-original-wearable-computers/ )). More than just counting calories, our mobile software applications offer intelligent, scientifically-backed, customized nutrition- and exercise-coaching designed to impact habits and behavior.

Our flagship app, Noom Weight Loss Coach, has been the #1 top grossing health & fitness application since 2012. It achieves the best outcomes in the industry with over 10 pounds lost per paid member. How, you ask? Great question! It has:

  • A coaching engine that generates personalized daily tasks & realtime motivational feedback;

  • The world’s most accurate food database, crowd-sourced by users & instantly searchable;

  • Virtual support groups created using automated clustering technology and tracked using scalable management tools.

  • A focus on simplicity and friendliness, to make all of the above easy to use

  • Many more features focused around guidance & motivation for our users

Our Benefits

If you want to learn how a startup really works on the inside, then Noom is the place for you. We have an incredible amount of transparency, with weekly all-company TGIFs where the wine and the information both flow freely (much to our legal counsel’s dismay). Because you’ll have equity in the company and have to make many decisions in your work, it’s important for you to know what’s going on.

We have an amazing chef (we love her!) who prepares gourmet lunches every day for all employees (along with afternoon smoothies and random breakfasts and dinners), a lively office with frequent visitors, and a dedicated team who work hard and play hard, with frequent offsites (beach, anyone?) and team outings (from shuffleboard to wine tasting). We also have more cakes than is probably healthy (welcome cakes, birthday cakes, goodbye cakes and cakes just because -- no joke).

Plus health insurance (100% paid by Noom) and a 401(k). We also have a $200 wellness budget, which you can spend on everything from triathlon registration fees to massages.

title: Software Engineer
description:
We are a Santa Monica-based startup developing the latest in real-time communication software for the medical industry.

What are we looking for?

A seasoned engineer with experience working with real-time communication, such as instant messaging/chat, media streaming (video conferencing), and/or bidirectional communication.

It is important to us that this individual have had experience at a company who is a leader in the real-time messaging/chat industry.

The ideal candidate would be located in the greater Los Angeles area, but we’re open to candidates in the Bay Area as well (Palo Alto, San Francisco, etc.).

Requirements

  • BS in computer science or equivalent experience
  • Experience with at least one Javascript MVC such as Backbone, Angular, or Ember
  • 3 yrs.+ experience with Ruby
  • Experience working on real-time communication software
  • Well-versed with Git command-line and GitHub for task management
  • Preferred: mobile application development experience (hybrid or native)
  • Preferred: Backbone experience
  • Preferred: Deep knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 and Responsive web design
  • Preferred: PhoneGap or Cordova experience (we use this for prototyping)

We offer a flexible work schedule.
how_to_apply: Email your resume, GitHub/LinkedIn profile, and/or CV to chris@medroster.com

title: Senior UI Developer
description:
Senior UI Developer

We’re the engineering team that designs, develops and delivers the web-based software-as-a-service applications that are changing the way leading technology and product companies get their products to market. We’re looking for someone who appreciates both the joy and responsibility of delivering web services that matter. We are serious about delivering secure and reliable applications and services, but we also think great engineers thrive in a culture of pride and self-discipline rather than management-imposed rule-making. We use agile methodologies and best-of-breed open source tools to make our development process open, collaborative, and fun, and in our technical operations we apply the same simple but rigorous approach to designing and managing our infrastructure.

Responsibilities

Develop, improve and maintain the Web layer (HTML/CSS/JS) for Arena SaaS applications.
Develop, improve and maintain the Application layer of Arena SaaS applications.
Document and communicate your designs.
Prototype UI for potential features for inclusion in future versions of Arena SaaS applications based on design mockups. Translate prototypes into final production quality code.
Leverage unit- and integration-test automation to ensure code quality and maintainability.
Debug customer-reported issues and fix bugs.
Help quality assurance develop test plans based on requirements and functional design.
As the developer on a multi-disciplinary team with product management, design, quality assurance and operations, participate in requirements analysis, technical design & code reviews.

Requirements

Proven expertise in developing clean, production quality web application code.
Expert in HTML, HTML5, CSS, Javascript, AJAX & the DOM (with 5+ years of front-end experience).
Solid understanding of browser compatibility issues.
Experience with modern client-side MVC frameworks, preferably AngularJS.
5+ years experience developing multi-tiered web applications, preferably in a SaaS environment.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Passion for quality, clean design and attention to detail.

title: Lead Developer, Ruby
description:
Hello Labs is hiring an experienced developer to help us build and launch new software for the mobile telecommunications industry. We look for staff who want to work together to build valuable, high-quality products for our customers. We encourage learning and are always open to new ideas - especially if they lead to us delivering better software.

What we use:

  • Our technology stack currently includes Ruby on Rails, Postgresql, Ember JS, and AWS (CloudFormation, EC2, S3, CloudFront, DynamoDB, etc.)
  • We use Github, Hipchat, Sococo, Splunk, and Atlassian and Google products to stay organized and in touch

Who we want:

  • You communicate well - in your code and in correspondence with non-technical people
  • You are approachable and humble
  • You love learning and teaching, and are able to give and receive constructive criticism
  • You enjoy being involved in high-level design and planning
  • You strive to be an expert with your toolset

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Great family benefits (Health, Vision, Dental, 401(k) matching)
  • An agile development environment
  • A small team who meets virtually for daily standups and works from stories in a 2-week sprint cycle
  • Paid trips to Florida to hang out and work with us
  • Paid trips to developer conferences
  • We cover tools for learning, like books and classes
  • Flexibility for time off to do personal things

Want to apply? Great. We’d love for you to include these things:

  • Your projects or favorite contributions on Github or Stack Overflow
  • What you’re currently interested in learning or wish you had time to learn
  • A link to your resume

title: Senior Software Engineer, Machine Learning - 38088593
description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Create groundbreaking technology for large-scale systems, spoken language, big data, and artificial intelligence. And work with the people who created the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking.

In this role you'll work with a great small team to solve hard problems that improve the lives of millions customers.

(1) You'll be part of a small, talented, and motivated team that operates like a startup within Apple.

(2) You'll solve new and difficult problems in areas including machine learning, feature definition, indexing, search, information extraction, and performance optimization.

(3) You'll ship code that runs on the devices you use every day and powers products that are critical to the lives of millions of users.

Key Qualifications:
•Experience using machine learning techniques for classification, parsing, and/or ranking
•Direct contribution to the design and implementation of innovative products that were successfully shipped and used by consumers
•Minimum of 5 years experience building large-scale consumer facing software
•Experience with search or indexing a plus
•Experience in extracting signal from noise in large unstructured datasets a plus
•Experience in iOS development with C, C++, Objective-C, or Swift a plus

Description:
We’re looking for someone with specialized knowledge and general skills. Someone who can architect new features one day and optimize inner loops the next. The ideal candidate has a strong mix of education and practical experience, and loves diving in to interesting problems head first.

Work includes:
Using NLP and ML techniques to bring order to unstructured data
Ensuring high quality and agility with unit and integration tests

You'll commit code on your second day.

Education:
Strong computer science fundamentals required - no matter how you got them.


Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: Mobile Developer
description:

title: Android Engineer

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
Our Mission

At Inventables, our mission is to ignite the digital manufacturing revolution by simplifying the path from idea to finished product. We believe the world is at the beginning of a new renaissance. We see power in product development shifting from major corporations to individual designers and entrepreneurs. The availability of low-cost manufacturing tools and low-cost distribution on Internet sites are leveling the playing field. Small teams can now make unique high value products that major corporations can’t justify because they aren’t for the masses.

We're looking for a few remarkable software engineers to join our small team and help us realize our mission of igniting the digital manufacturing revolution by simplifying the path from idea to finished product. It will be your job to build software that makes it possible for people to collaborate on building physical things with digital tools. Check out our in-browser 3D Carving app, Easel. Inventables is building its reputation as the place you go when you want to use digital fabrication tools to design and manufacture a product.

How We Work

We use agile software development techniques to focus our coding efforts on solving our business goals. We use Rails, Javascript, RSpec, Cucumber, and we run everything on the Amazon AWS platform. We often pair program, and we follow a test-driven development process. We deliver early and often. We believe that these practices lead to higher code quality.

We have a culture that makes time for innovation: every Friday is “Free Point Friday” where our development team works on what they think is most important – no questions asked. Check out Cohortly and Oneth1ng for just a couple examples of things we’ve built on Free Point Friday.

About You

We’re looking for someone who wants to work in a VC-funded startup that was formerly bootstrapped. You have a passion for web development, are self-motivated, and enjoy working in a user-focused, highly intelligent, entrepreneurial environment. We look for aptitude, not experience, but you probably have experience working with dynamic languages, are ruthless about testing and refactoring, and bring superior skills in the following areas:

  • Ruby, Rails
  • Object-oriented programming
  • BDD/TDD, Agile practices
  • Pair programming
  • Javascript, CSS, AJAX
  • Linux server/stack administration (Apache, MySQL, Postfix, etc)

Compensation

  • The chance to help build a technical team
  • The chance to have a big impact on building a successful startup
  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • BC/BS Health Insurance, $500 deductible, 100% coverage at no additional cost to you (coverage for spouse/family available at an additional cost)
  • Options Program
  • 401(k) program with match
  • Exploration budget - to keep you creative
  • Free Point Friday (work on what you think is important)
  • Tell us the tools you need - Mac or PC and software
  • Fast-paced work environment
how_to_apply:
Send an email to apply@inventables.com including the following information:

  • Your name
  • Your resume
  • A link to one software project you built along with a short description of what the software does and what your specific contributions were to it
  • A paragraph about why you want to join our team

title: Help Build a More Creative, Beautiful World
description:
Fractured Atlas helps artists succeed as entrepreneurs. We build software that helps artists raise money, find space to perform, insure their work, ticket their shows, and connect with their patrons to build lasting relationships.

ABOUT YOU

You’ve been working on Ruby on Rails for several years. You have experience working on production applications and can talk about what went wrong and what went right with your current project. Ruby is great, for sure, but you’re into lots of other technologies too.

ABOUT US

Fractured Atlas is a non-profit tech company. Our goal is to change the world by fostering creativity, not to maximize profits for some VC investor.

When working with us, you’ll be changing the world through code.

We fulfill our mission through technology products used by our members. Artful.ly manages ticketing, donations, and patrons for some of the most innovative performing arts organizations in New York and across the country. SpaceFinder creates online marketplaces for renting rehearsal, performance, and studio spaces. Our fiscal sponsorship program helps raise tens of millions of dollars each year so independent artists can create new work. Our insurance program has helped over 10,000 artists and organizations get quality coverage at amazing rates.

We build these tools using a blend of Ruby on Rails, jQuery, Haml, Sass, Solr, MySQL, Postgres, and Twitter Bootstrap. We're always diving into new technology to see how it can help make our applications better. If you have some tech that you're really excited about then we'll find a way to use it and improve the product.

Our products are young but very successful so far. We want to add a talented and passionate developer (like you!) to help us grow these products from early success to long-term prosperity.

WE’LL GET ALONG GREAT IF YOU HAVE...

  • Enthusiasm
  • Attention to Detail
  • Proficiency in Ruby and Rails
  • A connection to the arts

NOT REQUIRED, BUT EXTRA EXCITING WOULD BE…

  • Experience with Heroku and Amazon AWS/EC2/RDS
  • Made contributions to open source products
  • Interest or experience in UI/UX engineering.

REMOTE

You can live anywhere you want (as long as it’s in a US time zone and you’ve got solid English language skills). Fractured Atlas’s headquarters is in midtown Manhattan, so if you happen to be NYC-based and want to work from here, we’ll happily make room for you. The majority of our software development team is remote, though, so we need the kind of developer who thrives in that setup

SALARY AND BENEFITS

  • Starting salary is $90,000
  • Health and dental insurance
  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Budget to buy or build your own hardware
  • Paid vacation, personal, and sick days
  • TransitChek if you’re in NYC
  • Professional development budget to use to buy software or take classes in anything
  • Fun office with fun people, a Wii Lounge, Waffle Wednesdays, and lots of assorted other goodies
  • An alternative to typical startup culture; you’ll work hard here, but you’re also expected to have a life outside work
how_to_apply:
To be considered for the position, please email the items below in one PDF-formatted file with your name as the filename to Tim Cynova, Deputy Director at jobs@fracturedatlas.org. Include “Software Engineer” as the email’s subject line.

  • A substantive cover letter. Tell us about yourself, what you've done, and how you can help drive our products to success.
  • Code samples or links to work on Github, Stack Overflow, etc.
  • A résumé no longer than 2 pages outlining your educational and professional experience.

Incomplete submissions will not be considered nor will submissions sent via postal mail or fax. No calls, no recruiters please (we mean it).

In addition to submitting your CV, we ask that you answer the following questions. This helps us get a glimpse at valuable aspects of your personality that are not present in a typical CV. If you take the time to answer these questions, we'll spend the time reading them! Please attach answers to your CV.

1)Introduce yourself and why we should consider you for this position. Tell us things that are not on your CV, such as what you feel is most relevant about yourself, your interest in programming and gaming, and your interest in Lumba.

2) When and how did you learn to program? What motivated you to learn programming initially, and why did you stick with it?

3) Tell us about one of your personal software projects (defined as a project not required by a college curriculum or by a job, but done primarily for your own enjoyment or learning).

4) What is the most useful or interesting open source software you've used (or contributed to) recently? What did you like about it/them?

title: Mobile and Web Software Engineer
description:
In the fast-paced, ever-growing world of Healthcare, Humana relies on the latest technology and trends for sharing and storing information, communication and security. We need experts in technology to help us develop and maintain our networks, hardware, and software—to ensure our systems run smoothly and efficiently, keep us on the forefront of innovation in healthcare, and retain our competitive edge. At Humana, we want to help people everywhere, including our associates lead their best lives and achieve lifelong well-being. We look for talented individuals who share this passion for helping others, who have naturally curious and innovative minds, and who want a career where they can use their technical skills to make a positive impact on the lives of our members.

Fast, Sustainable Development, Forever.

We pair program, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We practice and teach an approach to mobile & web development that applies across industries and organizations, so you’ll experience all types of teams, products, and technologies. We set up regular retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we’re doing right so we can improve on it. And we believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.

Change The Way Mobile is Delivered

We do mobile differently. Test Driven Development in the mobile sphere produces high-quality, reliable and more maintainable code. We believe that methodical, steady, relentless forward momentum drives consistent results, and mobile should not be excluded from this process.

Role Essentials

BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience; 2+ years experience in mobile development ; Experience with mobile application development (iOS, Android) ; Programming experience in: Java, Objective-C, or C++; Experience with mobile web development: HTML5 ; Experience with TDD/ agile processes ; Programming experience in Java, Ruby, C# a plus ; Experience in cloud deployments a plus

Create your own mobile Apps? We would love to see them. Interested in becoming a Humana Associate? We’re seeking more amazing mobile developers to add to our Louisville, KY team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.

Humana Inc., headquartered in Louisville, Ky., is a leading health care company that offers a wide range of insurance products and health and wellness services that incorporate an integrated approach to lifelong well-being. By leveraging the strengths of its core businesses, Humana believes it can better explore opportunities for existing and emerging adjacencies in health care that can further enhance wellness opportunities for the millions of people across the nation with whom the company has relationships.

title: Developer
description:
ACCOMPANI At Accompani, we are evolving the future of relationship intelligence. Our platform integrates with your email, contacts, social feeds and more to keep you ingeniously informed on your professional connections at all times, turning your network into a constant stream of opportunity.

OUR STORY Accompani grew out of the simple idea – your network is your single most powerful and proprietary asset for the duration of your career. Yet there is currently no service out there that helps you manage it with depth, strengthen it with relevant context, and benefit daily from its full potential. So we decided to build it & name it ‘Accompani’ because we accompany you everywhere.

THE OPPORTUNITY As a Software Engineer at Accompani you’ll work alongside CTO and co-founder Matthias Ruhl, a 9-year Google veteran and large scale systems expert who helped push the Google Analytics backend beyond 900,000 requests/second. He's an MIT PhD who won the ACM programming competition, and still helps judge it.

The engineering team at Accompani is lean, agile, and rapid-fire, so the projects we work on are constantly changing based on our priorities. Every member of the team gets great exposure to our full stack from server to client, so there are countless opportunities to solve problems across the entire length of our codebase.

You have:

BS in CS or related fields from a competitive university. MS or PhD a plus Experience in developing web and/or mobile apps (iOS a big plus) Programming experience in one or more of Ruby, C/C++, Objective-C Solid foundation in Computer Science (algorithms, data structures, software design) Great attitude and ability to thrive and learn in a blazingly fast-paced environment

Bonus points for:

Being a generalist—curiosity about and ability to work on different parts of the system (backend, front-end, mobile, data mining) Experience in implementing large scale data processing systems Solid knowledge of UNIX/Linux, AWS

title: Developer Evangelist
description:
New Relic Developer Evangelist San Francisco, CA

The Community and Evangelism team at New Relic works with communities and evangelists of all kinds to increase New Relic’s brand awareness, educate and grow existing users, and increase the company’s thought leadership.

We target existing communities (online and onsite such as on StackOverflow and at Dev events) and educate them about New Relic. We also build New Relic-focused communities such as our online community forum and User Group meet-ups.

We leverage high profile community and thought leaders who want to spread the word about New Relic to their audiences. We are building out an in-house team, which will evangelize New Relic’s products and community activities. The personas that we target include Developers, Architects, DevOps, IT ops, and CxOs in various areas of business.

In this role, you will be the face and voice of New Relic, primarily to Java and .NET communities (potentially with slight overlap into other communities such as Node, Rails, Python, and PHP). You know the concerns, interests, demographics, and cultures of your audiences, and the ways in which we can connect deeply and effectively with them.

You are creative and passionate about connecting with technical audiences, thinking outside of the box for fun and new activities that will capture our audiences’ attention and have them love New Relic as much as we do.

You will work with our team members who own Onsite and Online community engagement to create assets that:

  • Educate our users and prospects (write or edit blog posts, create recorded content, speak at conferences, own product training at User Group events)
  • Connect with their style (plan hands-on activities, meetups, Dev events, DevOps trainings, hackathons)
  • Connect with their voice (own messaging, give feedback for branding)
  • Excite them (create social media, campaigns, events activities, fun giveaways)
  • Build a sense of community/belonging (own in-person events, networking, career opportunities)
  • Represent them (shared best practices)
  • Help build New Relic as a technical thought leader (non-marketing content on open source, maker activities, sharing our stories as users of technology)
  • Present you as a public evangelist and internal advocate for New Relic
  • Align with other company stakeholders in Marketing as well as in other teams such as Support, Engineering, Salesetc) to create cross-functional teams around shared goals, projects, assets, and other activities

Qualifications and Requirements

  • 6+ years of related experience in community marketing, technical marketing, and/or product marketing
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal, facilitation, and communication skills
  • Ability to quickly research, understand, articulate, and discuss technical topics
  • Experience creating or running a successful Developer community program
  • Success stories of creating Developer and DevOps-focused messaging, content, and assets
  • Experience presenting to developers and business audiences
  • Proven track record of working cross-functionally across multiple organizations.
  • Bachelor's degree (minimum) in Computer Science, Business, or Technical Field required

A little about us

New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our 90,000 customers use New Relic every day to optimize more than three million applications.

New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.

Our office is in the tech-rich urban center of San Francisco, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats. We provide competitive compensation, stock options and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.) -- all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.

New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Systems Architect
description:
As the Systems Architect at Coolblue you think big, build small and stay ahead of the curve.

What you tell your friends you do

"You know how in "How I Met Your Mother", Ted is an architect who designs buildings? If he'd designed IT systems he'd be a lot more like Barney. Being the Systems Architect for the fastest growing e-commerce company in the Benelux is that cool."

What you will really be doing

  • Developing a long term vision for a full stack systems architecture based on microservices.
  • Involving all your technical and non-technical stakeholders by explaining and translating your vision into concepts relevant to their domains.
  • Setting technical standards for technologies, such as design constraints and code conventions.
  • Constructing a "tech tree" of individual building blocks and the possibilities they unlock.
  • Providing insight to stakeholders on the progress being made in realizing the long term vision.

How will you be doing this

  • Initiating and guiding projects that help create the technical building blocks for the architecture.Taking a DevOps approach in everything you do, always thinking from a full stack point of view.
  • Evangelising the architecture, through frequent presentations and prototypes for example.
  • Taking a hands-on approach when needed, but preferring to take a step back and let others find their way.
  • Visualizing the work that's been done and what steps we could take next, so the technical roadmap is always aligned with business priorities.

Our stack

Coolblue uses quite a broad technology stack and we greatly value open standards and interoperability. We actively develop in PHP, Node.js and C#, and maintain a large Delphi codebase. Our data is currently being handled by Oracle and MySQL RDBMS, Elasticsearch, Memcached and Redis. But expect this list to grow, as our move towards a microservices oriented architecture is giving us a lot of freedom when choosing our data stores. Other technologies you'll come across at Coolblue are Git(Hub), TeamCity, HAL, automated testing, RabbitMQ and many more.

What we have worked on last quarter

  • Further improving on our continuous deployment pipeline.
  • Creating additional headroom in our public facing infrastructure to handle load spikes by optimizing software, removing bottlenecks, replacing hardware and adding optional cloud capacity.

Team

As the Systems Architect, your work is being used by the whole IT Development department. You assist our Scrum teams in implementing it and work with Product Owners in aligning the technical roadmap with their backlogs.

Required experience & skills

  • You've several years of experience in designing and realizing modern, distributed systems architectures.
  • Your idea of building large scale systems doesn't revolve around a single vendor's technologie du jour.
  • You think big and build small. In the end it's about getting things done.
  • You know that CAP theorem is not a comic book character.
  • You can discuss REST with Roy Fielding without him yelling at you.
  • You take pride in what you do, but welcome feedback.
  • You're able to tell there, they're and their apart - you're proficient in English.
  • You don't do things just because they were always done that way. You don't ignore the lessons learned, however - even those learned by others.
  • You're adaptable and don't mind stepping outside of your comfort zone.
  • You take automation over documentation any day of the week.
  • You're willing to relocate to Rotterdam or somewhere nearby.

We offer

  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables and awesome parties.

title: Senior PHP Backend Developer (f/m)
description:
We are Home24, Europe‘s largest online furniture store. With over 100,000 products from more than 350 manufacturers, we offer our clients a unique range of furniture, lamps and home accessories.

Our Home24 loft is situated in a former cigar factory in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg. From there, our young and international team manages our web shops in Germany, France, Austria, the Netherlands, Switzerland and Belgium. Since 2009 we have been working with great passion and enthusiasm for a great cause: We revolutionize the furniture market. Therefore we are looking for you from now on as:

Senior PHP Backend Developer (f/m)

Are you interested in building software used by hundreds of colleagues or building software for hundreds of thousands customers? Do you like writing fast, high quality code at a rapid pace? Home24 is seeking for Senior PHP - Backend Developers who are passionate of writing great software for web applications. This position is full-time and based in our great office in Berlin.

Responsibilities

  • Work with product managers to implement the next generation of Home24 e-commerce features
  • Build efficient and reusable PHP-software
  • Identify and address performance issues
  • Participate in design and code reviews
  • Identify and prototype best practices for backend engineering

Requirements

  • Expert knowledge of PHP5/OOP, MySQL-databases and datamodelling
  • Knowledge about webservices (REST/SOAP)
  • Experience with Zend-Framework is a plus
  • Experience with Java and Solr is a plus
  • Ability to write high-performance and reusable PHP code-modules
  • Passion for performance debugging and benchmarking
  • 3+ years of experience building web applications
  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, also natural sciences possible

What we offer you

  • High-end computers with SSD hard disk, 16G of memory and 4х Xeon 3,X Ghz + 2x 24 inch screens
  • Skill-dependent, negotiable salary – don’t hesitate to approach us
  • Highly professional colleagues
  • Benefits as employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and more

If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, we look forward to hearing from you. Please send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, if available), as well as your expected salary and earliest possible start date via apply

title: Software Engineer
description:
As a software engineer at Thumbtack, you'll be responsible for bringing the Thumbtack vision to life. That means discovering, researching, and implementing anything that moves us towards our vision in collaboration with the engineering team, designers, product managers, and the rest of Thumbtack. This may mean scaling product features and infrastructure to support a fast-growing user base, building internal tools to give us insight into Thumbtack ecosystem, iterating on the core mechanics of the marketplace, or exploring and prototyping any number of new and compelling ideas. In any case, as a software engineer, it always means managing complexity through thoughtful software design to ensure we can grow and scale our product without sacrificing development speed or quality.

We expect you to be excited by Thumbtack's mission to transform the local services economy, making it more efficient and useful for both sides of the marketplace. We deeply believe in the transformative power of technology in the services industry.

Our engineering process values ownership and individual contribution within a collaborative environment. To this end, you will have significant autonomy in choosing the kinds of projects you undertake. We expect you to take a deliberate and thoughtful approach to your decision-making while also exercising great freedom and creativity. We hope that you'll enjoy crafting sentences and paragraphs as much as you enjoy crafting methods and classes.

About you

  • You like finding interesting problems in the world, then tackling them head on with dedication and creativity
  • You are comfortable expressing yourself with written and verbal communication
  • You like talking and engaging with users to help them express their needs in ways that can be used as feedback for future iterations of the product
  • You're not one to pick up a hammer then look for nails, though you do like finding new hammers
  • You appreciate a good statistical analysis and the power of data-driven decisions, and you might like running A/B tests
  • You're excited about the code you write, and work hard to make it maintainable for your future self as well as your colleagues on the engineering team
  • You're comfortable working with a variety of technologies (we use a mix of PHP, Python, JavaScript, Postgres, Mongo, and loose leaf tea)

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Please apply using the following link: http://grnh.se/g06lyt

title: Ruby / JavaScript Engineer - Scientific Visualization and Informatics
description:
About Us

CDD Vault is the leading hosted collaborative drug discovery informatics platform. Every day, scientists around the world manage, analyze and securely collaborate around their data using CDD Vault. This type of collaboration is crucial to research on under-funded diseases like Tuberculosis and Malaria and also provides a strategic, competitive advantage in commercial markets.

Our long list of customers includes academic labs, biotechs, big pharmas, government laboratories, as well as leading funders of collaborations like the NIH, the EU FP7, and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. We are a small company (less than 20 employees), we are profitable, and we are growing.

About You

You will have a huge impact on how we design, build and deliver our application. You should be a generalist and enjoy working across the software stack. Our current technologies include Ruby (Rails), JavaScript, MySQL, Java, and Solr.

We look for engineers who love finding efficient, thoughtful, and highly useable solutions to a variety of challenges. You should strive to write efficient, maintainable code and you should enjoy pushing code every few weeks.

Sample projects include:

  • Building our visualization suite with modern HTML5 tools
  • Designing a data model and UX that allow scientists to invite collaborators and selectively share data with them
  • Extending our API for third party developers and integrations
  • Optimizing import, export and computation of large data sets
  • Improving our DevOps tools and completing our transition to infrastructure-as-code

Conditions: We consider applicants seeking full-time employment as a permanent employee. You must be local to the bay area or interested in relocation.

To apply, please contact work@collaborativedrug.com with your resume, a few words about why you're interested, and links to things you’ve built.

title: Software developer in a young, fast growing IT company! (relocation offered)
description:
Job description

We’ve set our eyes on the world – we want to offer our safety software globally, to complex businesses in many industries. As we grow we also want to increase our quality, to automate the repetitive, and to take our software into the realm of 24/7 cloud availability. Care to join us?

As a software developer within eVision:

You will:

  • Architect and build new features for our health and safety products
  • Member of an Agile Software Development Team, working with processes such as Kanban or Scrum
  • Work on technical stories such as multi-tenancy architecture or deployment systems
  • Own parts of the technical system, create vision and coordinate their evolution
  • Focus on code quality and manage its evolution

You will work with

  • A software development team composed of software developers, QA engineers, Product Owner
  • Project managers that run the delivery of projects
  • Other teams such as teams that train the users •Your very own Development Manager, that helps you grow and be effective as a professional

You will have/be

  • Good knowledge of, and proven experience with: C#, .NET Framework 4.0+, SOLID
  • Firm grasp of design patterns and of SOLID, and experience using them in a commercial application
  • Experience with Domain Driven Design, CQRS, Event Sourcing desirable
  • Extensive experience with code quality – unit testing, TDD, coding standards, code review, automated testing concepts and defensive coding are essential
  • Knowledge of HTTP and .NET HTTP frameworks – ASP.NET MVC, etc
  • Knowledge of Linq and relational and non-relational data stores – MSSQL, MongoDB, etc.
  • Able to understand and write multi-threaded code
  • Able to design logging, reporting, fail over systems
  • Fluency in GIT, continuous integration (with Jenkins, Teamcity, etc.) and continuous deployment
  • Good grasp of both technical and functional characteristics of software products, particularly in terms of scalability, performance, usability and quality
  • Knowledge of concepts of scripting and automation

Our future colleague:

  • Writes good code because it’s one of their life passions
  • Is a life-long learner and experimenter
  • Is thirsty for information and steps out daily of yesterday’s comfort zone to get it
  • Thinks with the product and the company, proposes features and prototypes tools
  • Is a problem solver, a hacker that gets the job done and focuses on continuous improvement as the key to better speed and quality
  • Is proactively making decisions and compromise, and helps others understand why they had to be made
  • Communicates effectively with colleagues that work on the same product

Why work with us

  • Because our product matters to people – it saves their health and their life
  • Because we are serious and pragmatic about our technology and quality
  • Because we support you as a leader of your own ideas and career choices, and as an innovator that dares to challenge the status quo
  • Because we focus on growth. Yours. We have tools to grow yourself as a developer – mentorship, teams, meetups, conferences, trainings and hackatons
  • Because smart and professional people work with us, and because they believe that teams are the key to our continuous success
  • Because we are fun, multicultural and have a dry, genuine sense of humor

Enough said. Time to hack. Send us your CV, show us your work, or give us a call to start.

Once your application has been submitted into the eVision recruitment database, it will be reviewed in accordance with the requirements of the vacant position. Due to the large volume of applicants, only short listed candidates will be contacted by the eVision recruitment team. If you have not been contacted within one month, your application has not been shortlisted.

All submitted CV’s will be kept on eVision’s database for one calendar year from the date of submission to be contacted for suitable vacancies that may arise in the future. If you object to this, please feel free to contact us.
how_to_apply: Please send your resume to our recruiter: Jerrol.spier@evision-software.com

title: Software Developers and Engineers
description:
Software Developers and Engineers Greater Manchester

Combat threats to UK security with your tenacity and technological expertise.

GCHQ works to keep Britain safe and secure in the face of wide-ranging threats from cyberspace and emerging technologies. To tackle different challenges, we deploy agile teams of engineers with expertise in a wide range of technologies, disciplines and skills – and with varying backgrounds, from new graduates to experienced professionals.

By joining us, you could find yourself reacting to real time events by delivering enhancements and systems that have to go live fast – perhaps a matter of minutes or hours. Or you might be working on complex systems and infrastructure, where solving the toughest problems can be a long term commitment. There are many other business critical tasks too, such as contributing to testing, user experience, integration, data algorithms, design and database architecture.

But whatever projects you’re involved in, you are guaranteed challenging, cutting-edge work that will stretch your abilities, strengthen your skills and expand your knowledge. And, you’ll be playing a valuable role in protecting the nation.

Requirements

  • A good communicator, you will be tenacious and quick-learning – ready to persevere when problems seem unsolvable, and to find innovative solutions that others miss. You’ll be keen to take responsibility, grapple with the latest technology threats and learn the techniques we use to solve unique problems.
  • It’s important that you have knowledge, understanding and practical skills in at least one programming language, and a desire to learn new programming languages.
  • You also need to have, or expect, a relevant degree in a Technical or Scientific field. Or you must experience in at least ONE of the following areas: Programming / Computers and computer networks / Operating systems / Telecommunications systems / IT and Network Security

Although most positions are full-time, GCHQ values a diverse workforce and has staff working a variety of working patterns including part-time, compressed hours and job-share. If you think you can deliver in these challenging roles, but would prefer different working hours, let us know and we’ll see what we can do.

To apply, please click the apply link on the right.

Closing date: 25 January 2015.

Applicants must be British citizens. GCHQ values diversity and welcomes applicants from all sections of the community.

We want our workforce to reflect the diversity of our work.

title: CRM Developer
description:

We are a Berlin-based, FinTech start-up. For the time being, we are in stealth mode. You will learn about us once we start talking.

Team of more than 20 professionals from more than 10 nationalities, our working language is English;

title: Software Engineer | Front-end
description:
Summary

Wikimedia’s Collaboration team is looking for a front-end developer who wants an exciting challenge. We are building the future of how our communities communicate in a multi-device world crossing desktop, handsets and tablets. Our volunteers are building the sum of all human knowledge, and we want to give them the best possible tools to discuss and collaborate. We need our features to be beautiful, usable, and performant and lead the web forward.

You’ll join an established team focused on the Flow project, evolving how our discussion and collaboration systems work, enabling both new and experienced editors to continue building content on Wikipedia and its fellow projects, across all languages.

Description

  • Build, test, refine and deploy new user-facing features within a small agile team
  • Use web standards to serve millions of users on Wikipedia
  • Delight our users no matter what device they use or where they are

Requirements

  • Know the front-end web stack in and out (JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS)
  • Obsessive about user experience, and works well with designers
  • Work on features that enable rapid and efficient collaboration among people all around the world

Pluses

  • Experience with responsive design, and user-generated content
  • Experience using and contributing to Wikimedia or MediaWiki projects
  • Knowledge of our front-end technological variations (Handlebars templating, LESS stylesheets, etc.), or similar ones, and familiarity with module-based JavaScript systems
  • Familiarity with server-side stack, such as PHP and MySQL
  • Experience working on open source, collaborative development projects

Show us your stuff! Please provide us with information you feel would be useful to us in gaining a better understanding of your technical background and accomplishments. Links to GitHub, your technical blogs, publications, personal projects, etc. are exceptionally useful. We especially appreciate pointers to your best contributions to open source projects.

About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is a San Francisco-based nonprofit entity committed to building a world in which everyone can freely share in the sum of all human knowledge. Projects include Wikipedia, which contains more than 17 million volunteer-authored articles in more than 280 languages. As a collective, these projects represent the largest collection of shared knowledge in human history, built and edited by millions of people. The web properties are the most highly visited web properties running on free and open source software in history. Wikipedia alone is visited by more than 480 million people monthly, making it the 5th most popular site in the world. The Wikimedia Foundation sustains and supports the volunteer community by providing the technical, and managerial, infrastructure and tools needed to continue their contributions.

More Information

title: Software Engineer - Mobile Android
description:
Summary

Wikimedia’s Mobile app team is looking for an Android developer who wants the challenge of making our apps the most beautiful, groundbreaking, and collaborative applications in the Google Play market. We’re passionate about our users and want to create new ways for them to contribute photos, videos and text natively from their devices to our sites. You will be joining a small established team to focus on Android aesthetics, performance, and user experience to create never before seen contributory pipelines for our web-properties across multiple devices.

Our team believes that Android is beautiful and we’re confident that it will change how people interact with Wikipedia over many years to come.

Description

  • Present Wikipedia content to users in new, exciting, and beautiful ways on mobile devices
  • Take your programming experience and apply it to improving and evolving our mobile projects
  • Enable millions of Android users to be able to contribute to Wikipedia

Requirements

  • Java, JS, HTML, CSS, JSON, etc. You know them inside out and upside down
  • An interest in details from small to big because you want to delight your users
  • Enjoying the danger of trying new things or turning the typical into the delightful

Pluses

  • Contributing to open source Android apps or libraries
  • Being familiar with Android design guidelines and best practices, especially Material Design
  • Having edited Wikipedia

Show us your stuff! Please provide us with information you feel would be useful to us in gaining a better understanding of your technical background and accomplishments. Links to GitHub, your technical blogs, publications, personal projects, etc. are exceptionally useful. We especially appreciate pointers to your best contributions to open source projects.

About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is the non-profit organization that operates Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia. Wikipedia and the other projects operated by the Wikimedia Foundation receive more than 431 million unique visitors per month, making them the 5th most popular web property worldwide. Available in more than 287 languages, Wikipedia contains more than 32 million articles contributed by a global volunteer community of more than 100,000 people. Based in San Francisco, California, the Wikimedia Foundation is an audited, 501(c)(3) charity that is funded primarily through donations and grants. The Wikimedia Foundation was created in 2003 to manage the operation of Wikipedia and its sister projects. It currently employs over 208 staff members. Wikimedia is supported by local chapter organizations in 40 countries or regions.

The Wikimedia Foundation offers competitive benefits. Fully paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!). A Wellness Program which provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, massages, cooking classes and much more. 401(k) retirement plan with matched contributions of 4% of annual salary.

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
Summary

The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for an Application Security Engineer to protect Wikipedia and our other projects. You'll be working with other developers and security engineers to create new security features, review the security of other’s code, and help find and fix security bugs before they're exploited.

As part of the Platform's Core team, you'll share the responsibility for ensuring MediaWiki is secure and architected to encourage safe development in the future. You focus will initially be on frontend security, and user facing security features.

  • Build security features
  • Review and deploy features developed by the foundation and our open-source community
  • Work with other development teams to ensure they make safe design and architectural decisions
  • Triage and fix reported security issues

  • 2+ years of application security experience

Can you imagine a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all human knowledge? At the Wikimedia Foundation, we do. title: Senior Software Engineer | Services
description:
Summary

Wikipedia is where the world turns to understand almost any topic — The Wikimedia Foundation is the nonprofit that operates Wikipedia with a small staff. We are looking for a great engineer who wants to modernize the infrastructure underlying Wikipedia with distributed storage, services and REST interfaces. If this excites you we welcome you to join us.

Description

  • Work with a small team of four.

  • Build a fully replicated storage service powering both internal services and our public REST content API (https://github.com/gwicke/restbase).

  • Collaborate with other teams on the development of services for tasks like job queues, notifications, math rendering, citation data retrieval or content classification.

  • Use the best available tools & languages for each task. Currently we work a lot with Node.js, Cassandra, Kafka and ElasticSearch, but also use other tools and languages like Python, Java, C, C++ and PHP where it makes sense. Go or Scala could be options in the future.

  • Build automated tests and thorough monitoring for the services being developed, and help package the services for internal and third party distribution.

  • Change the world for more than half a billion people every month ;)

Requirements

You have experience building large-scale server applications.

  • You think about clusters, caching and latencies.

  • Node.js experience is a plus, but it's way more important that you are familiar with issues in large-scale systems and are eager to learn new tools.

You are familiar with a diverse set of programming languages and have a strong understanding of core engineering concepts:

  • Unix process and concurrency models

  • Server application deployment and infrastructure automation

  • Relational & distributed databases (e.g. MySQL, Cassandra, Riak, HBase, DynamoDB)

  • Consistency trade-offs and transactional algorithms in distributed systems

  • Principles of fault tolerance and robustness

  • Security including authentication / authorization (OAuth 2, JWT)

You have experience leading an engineering team, and communicate effectively with other stakeholders.

You have a track record of combining a solid long-term architectural strategy with short-term progress.

With freedom comes responsibility. You direct your own work and are pro-active in asking for input.

You have a scientific mindset and empirically test your hypotheses.

BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent work experience

Pluses

  • Experience with open source technology and free culture, and have contributed to open source projects

  • Located in or near our San Francisco offices on a daily or at least on a semi-regular basis

  • You know what it means to be a volunteer or to coordinate the work of volunteers

  • Big ups if you are a contributor to Wikipedia

  • Please provide us with information you feel would be useful to us in gaining a better understanding of your technical background and accomplishments

Show us your stuff! If you have any existing open source software that you've developed (these could be your own software or patches to other packages), please share the URLs for the source. Links to GitHub, etc. are exceptionally useful.

title: Senior Technical Product Manager
description:
Summary

Wikimedia (the organization behind Wikipedia) is seeking a Senior Technical Product Manager to own the roadmap for our platform, services, and API work, serving nearly half a billion users per month. You will empower internal and external stakeholders to build world-changing applications on top of Wikipedia and our other projects in order to bring read and write access to the sum of all knowledge to every person on the planet.

Description

  • Ensure that work on the Mediawiki platform is consistent with Wikimedia’s strategic priorities and technology roadmap.
  • Apply success measures to all work the team undertakes, and develop a strong orientation towards measurable impact.
  • Empower developers to responsively integrate or reject volunteer or third party code contributions. In partnership with the Director of Platform, architects, and senior engineers, prioritize overall work on the MediaWiki platform and orchestrate the implementation of specific initiatives.
  • Represent the voice of (internal and external) developers and end users to platform development teams.
  • Ensure the work of platform development teams is visible and understood internally and externally, through appropriate reporting and communications.
  • Have a pulse on technology and industry trends, and create internal awareness to help continually move our platform and infrastructure forward.

Requirements

  • BA/BS in Computer Science, equivalent training in a technical field, or equivalent experience 5+ years experience in product management of a technical product area (e.g., API, developer tools).
  • Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams.
  • Familiarity with a broad range of systems development environments, including: Squid and Varnish, - Apache, Memcached, MySQL, PHP, Perl, Python and a broad range of open source components.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Pluses

  • Hands-on software engineering experience, especially in an open source context.
  • Experience with Wikimedia projects and MediaWiki.

title: Full Stack Developer - Analytics
description:
Summary

Help us create a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We are the Analytics Team at Wikimedia Foundation - engineers and scientists organizing data generated by the world's largest collaborative project and 5th largest website in the world. We protect privacy, share data, build APIs, and help our feature and product teams understand what to focus on.

We use open source tools as much as possible, and always open source our own work (https://git.wikimedia.org). Python, Java and Javascript make up most of our code, but we value using the right tool for the job. We have autonomy and responsibility and can have a large and immediate impact on the future of the site. Our world is vast and can be complicated, so we value communication, enthusiasm, and eagerness to learn more than certificates.

Description

  • Design, develop, test, and deploy new features, improvements and upgrades to the infrastructure that supports analytics operations to aggregate, serve and visualize our data. Currently these systems include software from the hadoop ecosystem (Hive, Apache Kafka) but also home grown software written mostly in C and python.
  • Assist developers and community members in identifying and resolving issues with the software and configuration of Wikimedia's analytics infrastructure.
  • Work and communicate effectively within a small team of five distributed across 3 time zones.

Requirements

  • Real world experience writing applications (web or otherwise) using both scripting (Python, Javascript, PHP) and compiled languages (Java, Scala, C, C#)
  • Experience with MySQL/Postgres or similar database technology
  • Experience developing APIs for data retrieval
  • Understanding of basic statistical concepts
  • Willingness to work collaboratively with the research team and the Wikimedia community
  • BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent work experience

Pluses

  • Experience with high traffic web site architectures and operations
  • Production experience with Hadoop and ecosystem (Pig, Hive, Streaming) technologies
  • A history of providing measurable results from analytical efforts
  • Experience with Flask, SQLAlchemy, node
  • You know what it means to be a volunteer or to coordinate the work of volunteers
  • Big ups if you are a contributor to Wikipedia

Show us your stuff! If you have any existing open source software that you've developed (these could be your own software or patches to other packages), please share the URLs for the source. Links to GitHub, etc. are exceptionally useful.

About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is the non-profit organization that operates Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia. Wikipedia and the other projects operated by the Wikimedia Foundation receive more than 431 million unique visitors per month, making them the 5th most popular web property worldwide. Available in more than 287 languages, Wikipedia contains more than 32 million articles contributed by a global volunteer community of more than 100,000 people. Based in San Francisco, California, the Wikimedia Foundation is an audited, 501(c)(3) charity that is funded primarily through donations and grants. The Wikimedia Foundation was created in 2003 to manage the operation of Wikipedia and its sister projects. It currently employs over 208 staff members. Wikimedia is supported by local chapter organizations in 40 countries or regions.

The Wikimedia Foundation offers competitive benefits. Fully paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!). A Wellness Program which provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, massages, cooking classes and much more. 401(k) retirement plan with matched contributions of 4% of annual salary.

More Information

http://blog.wikimedia.org

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
We're looking for someone to help build classroom software and admin tools to improve educational outcomes and reduce administrative burden. We view software as the backbone of our classroom and are working to digitize our entire curriculum to build a better learning experience and allow instructors to focus on providing one on one help to students. This software backbone will allow us to scale our physical programs very efficiently. You'll be responsible for iterating on our Online Academy (the current curriculum delivery mechanism for both our in person and online courses) and adding features like video lectures and in browser coding exercises. You'll also be helping build tools for student management, communication and evaluation tools.

What we're looking for:

  • Strong frontend development experience in HTML/CSS
  • Experience with Git, Javascript, CoffeeScript, SCSS
  • Ability to build fast and learn quickly
  • Good debugging and QA experience
  • Strong UX sense and good design thinking
  • Clear, simple thinking and creative problem solving ability
  • Ability to work well with others
  • Good development practices and clean code
  • Ability to accurately set timelines
  • Ability to clearly define specifications
  • Passion for education
